feels.name: Trust
feels.quote: He had a sense of rectitude and an honorable pride in satisfying the requirements of honor.

feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: The human soul moves in many channels, and Mr. Casaubon had a sense of rectitude and an honorable pride in satisfying the requirements of honor, which compelled him to find other reasons for his conduct than those of jealousy and vindictiveness.

feels.name: Anger
feels.quote: He was quite sure that Dorothea was the cause of Willâ€™s return from Rome, and his determination to settle in the neighborhood; and he was penetrating enough to imagine that Dorothea had innocently encouraged this course.

feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: He had recovered all his usual power of work: the illness might have been mere fatigue, and there might still be twenty years of achievement before him, which would justify the thirty years of preparation.

feels.name: Anticipation
feels.quote: He had begun now to frame possibilities for the future which were somehow more embittering to him than anything his mind had dwelt on before.

feels.name: Fear
feels.quote: To all the facts which he knew, he added imaginary facts both present and future which became more real to him than those because they called up a stronger dislike, a more predominating bitterness.

feels.name: Disgust
feels.quote: He utterly distrusts Will Ladislaw's morals, and it is his duty to hinder to the utmost the fulfillment of his designs.
